item.title: 【Albums (lossless)】FLAC - Kenny Burrell - K.B. Blues (Remastered) (2023) [HIGHRESAUDIO HRA 24bits/96.0kHz]
item.description:
Album info
Album-Release:
2023

HRA-Release:
03.11.2023

Label: CM BLUE NOTE (A92)

Genre: Jazz

Subgenre: Free Jazz

Artist: Kenny Burrell


"K.B. Blues (Remastered)"

Tracklist:
01 Nica's Dream (2000 Remaster)
02 Out For Blood (2000 Remaster)
03 K.B. Blues (2000 Remaster)
04 D.B. Blues (2000 Remaster)
05 K.B. Blues (Alternate Take / 2000 Remaster)




Info for K.B. Blues (Remastered)


Recorded in 1957, Kenny Burrell’s 3rd session as a leader for Blue Note presented the guitarist’s signature stylings with a crack team of hard boppers featuring Horace Silver, Hank Mobley, Doug Watkins, and Louis Hayes. Previously only issued on vinyl in Japan this swinging set is given a new shine with this Blue Note Edition produced by Joe Harley, mastered by Kevin Gray from the original analog master tapes.

Kenny Burrell had been recording for Blue Note less than a year when he entered Rudy Van Gelder’s Hackensack, New Jersey studio in February 1957 for his 3rd session as a leader for the label. The date presented the guitarist’s signature stylings with a crack team of hard boppers featuring Horace Silver on piano, Hank Mobley on tenor saxophone, Doug Watkins on bass, and Louis Hayes on drums. Side 1 finds the band stretching out on a jaunty take of Silver’s tune “Nica’s Dream,” written for the jazz baroness Pannonica de Koenigswarter, and Burrell’s hard charging “Out for Blood.” Side 2 offers up several views of the blues with an excellent version of Lester Young’s “D.B. Blues” book-ended by two different takes of Burrell’s easy-going “K.B Blues.”

Kenny Burrell, guitar
Horace Silver, piano
Hank Mobley, tenor saxophone
Doug Watkins, bass
Louis Hayes, drums

Recorded February 10, 1957 at Van Gelder Studio, Hackensack, New Jersey
Produced by Alfred Lion

Digitally remastered
